alert.note: Alert for Clark; Meade; Morton; Seward; Stevens (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 20 at 1:41AM CST until February 21 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Critical Danger of Wildfire Spread Expected Tuesday Afternoon... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT TUESDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 084, 085, 086, 087, AND 088... The National Weather Service in Dodge City has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect Tuesday afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 084 Morton, Fire Weather Zone 085 Stevens, Fire Weather Zone 086 Seward, Fire Weather Zone 087 Meade and Fire Weather Zone 088 Clark. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any ignitions will have the potential to burn out of control quickly, given the ongoing severe drought. Any outdoor burning is strongly discouraged Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
